1.text: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

2.text: The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouth of fools gush out folly.

3.text: Yahweh’s eyes are everywhere, keeping watch on the evil and the good.

4.text: A gentle tongue is a tree of life, but deceit in it crushes the spirit.

5.text: A fool despises his father’s correction, but he who heeds reproof shows prudence.

6.text: In the house of the righteous is much treasure, but the income of the wicked brings trouble.

7.text: The lips of the wise spread knowledge; not so with the heart of fools.

8.text: The sacrifice made by the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh, but the prayer of the upright is his delight.

9.text: The way of the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh, but he loves him who follows after righteousness.

10.text: There is stern discipline for one who forsakes the way: whoever hates reproof shall die.

11.text: Sheol and Abaddon are before Yahweh—how much more then the hearts of the children of men!

12.text: A scoffer doesn’t love to be reproved; he will not go to the wise.

13.text: A glad heart makes a cheerful face; but an aching heart breaks the spirit.

14.text: The heart of one who has understanding seeks knowledge, but the mouths of fools feed on folly.

15.text: All the days of the afflicted are wretched, but one who has a cheerful heart enjoys a continual feast.

16.text: Better is little, with the fear of Yahweh, than great treasure with trouble.

17.text: Better is a dinner of herbs, where love is, than a fattened calf with hatred.

18.text: A wrathful man stirs up contention, but one who is slow to anger appeases strife.

19.text: The way of the sluggard is like a thorn patch, but the path of the upright is a highway.

20.text: A wise son makes a father glad, but a foolish man despises his mother.

21.text: Folly is joy to one who is void of wisdom, but a man of understanding keeps his way straight.

22.text: Where there is no counsel, plans fail; but in a multitude of counselors they are established.

23.text: Joy comes to a man with the reply of his mouth. How good is a word at the right time!

24.text: The path of life leads upward for the wise, to keep him from going downward to Sheol.

25.text: Yahweh will uproot the house of the proud, but he will keep the widow’s borders intact.

26.text: Yahweh detests the thoughts of the wicked, but the thoughts of the pure are pleasing.

27.text: He who is greedy for gain troubles his own house, but he who hates bribes will live.

28.text: The heart of the righteous weighs answers, but the mouth of the wicked gushes out evil.

29.text: Yahweh is far from the wicked, but he hears the prayer of the righteous.

30.text: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart. Good news gives health to the bones.

31.text: The ear that listens to reproof lives, and will be at home among the wise.

32.text: He who refuses correction despises his own soul, but he who listens to reproof gets understanding.

33.text: The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom. Before honor is humility.
